actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to reduce from five years to two years the amount of coverage which an individual must generally have had within a specified 10-year period in order to qualify for disability insurance benefits and the disability freeze.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends Title II (Old Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to reduce from five to two years the amount of time an individual must have held employment covered by such title within a specified ten year period in order to qualify for disability insurance benefits.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to reduce from five years to two years the amount of coverage which an individual must generally have had within a specified 10-year period in order to qualify for disability insurance benefits and the disability freeze.
